"We are all a little damaged, Bee. Some of us more than others.”― T.M. Frazier, The Dark Light of Day
“My body is my journal, and my tattoos are my story.”― Johnny Depp
“Show me a man with a tattoo and I will show you a man with an interesting past.” ― Jack London
“Wear your heart on your skin in this life.”― Sylvia Plath
“Books are to me as homemade tattoos are to an inmate. Can not get enough of them.”― Laurie Notaro, I Love Everybody
“I am a canvas of my experiences, my story is etched in lines and shading, and you can read it on my arms, my legs, my shoulders, and my stomach.”― Kat Von D
“We are all a little damaged, Bee. Some of us more than others.”― T.M. Frazier, The Dark Light of Day
“She had a flower tattoo on her wrist; "What does that mean?" he asked her. "Absolutely nothing," she said, "it's just a flower.”― C. JoyBell C.
“Our bodies were printed as blank pages to be filled with the ink of our hearts”― Michael Biondi
“The cafe was called Tattoos. The fella who owned it did not have any tattoos... but we never saw his wife.” ― Karl Pilkington
“They keep track of time. Sometimes things happen and you feel that you need to mark them down.”― Scott OConnor, Untouchable
“Seriously, what is it about men in jeans and bare feet which is so totally hot?”― Samantha Towle
“This would go a lot easier if you would stop screaming in pain, Zoe told the muscular man lying beneath her.” ― Jaime Rush
“I don’t have any myself,” Mia said, her voice slow and deliberate. “But I’ve always found tattoos sexy.”― Katherine McIntyre, Confined Desires
"That will become inaccurate at some point, " Omar pointed out.” ― Domashita Romero, Complicated Creation
